meanings.definition: Used to refer to someone or something different or distinct from the one already mentioned.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to try something different, so she chose the other option.
meanings.sent2: I have one book, and I need to find the other one.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked at the other cat in the mirror and got confused.
meanings.sent4: His other self, the one he kept hidden, emerged in moments of anger.
meanings.sent5: The other side of the mountain was covered in lush greenery.

meanings.definition: An additional or further thing or person.
meanings.sent1: I have one pencil, but I need the other for my drawing.
meanings.sent2: She bought one cookie for herself and another for her friend.
meanings.sent3: The other in the pair of shoes was missing, leaving her with an odd set.
meanings.sent4: The other of the twins was known for being more mischievous.
meanings.sent5: He always kept an extra key in case he lost the other.

meanings.sent1: She preferred the other route as it was less crowded.
meanings.sent2: The other dress she tried on was too big for her.
meanings.sent3: His other idea was to build a treehouse in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The other solution to the problem proved to be more effective.
meanings.sent5: The other flavor of ice cream was a surprising delight.
